subject: Re: [junit] Re: Compiling JUnit
msgSnippet: ... [snip] ... The faq (in particular):- http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#started_2 includes information about setting your classpath to include
messageBody:
fstatovci wrote:
> Ok. Here is whats happening.
>
> Junit has a samples directory under org/junit/samples. I modified the
> file called SimpleTest.java and tried to compile it using javac
> SimpleTest.java
[snip]

> SimpleTest.java:3: <identifier> expected
> import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;
> ^
> SimpleTest.java:3: '.' expected
> import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;

The faq (in particular):-

http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#started_2

includes information about setting your classpath to include the
junit.jar files. This will allow the compiler to know about the junit
classes and make them available for import.

> ^
> SimpleTest.java:16: illegal character: \64
> @Before public void setUp() {
> ^
What version of java are you using?

typing :-
java -version

at the command prompt will give you this. Are you using a build older
than 1.5? If so you need to bring your JDK up to date, so it knows what
to do with annotations (@Before).


--
Mark
